cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, expected to curve slightly west and come ashore along the southeast Louisiana coast before turning west inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana between Morgan City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (near the New Orleans / Port of South Louisiana area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (also Storm Surge Warning, Tropical Storm Warning for Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas/Metro New Orleans)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City; Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning from Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Alabama, with greatest impacts expected along the southeast Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (40–70 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible as the core nears the southeast Louisiana coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft of surge possible from Morgan City eastward through Lake Borgne and into the lower Mississippi River and adjacent lakes – includes the Port of South Louisiana reach.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated totals near 6 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding along the river and low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents; rapid river level changes could affect mooring integrity.
